description: Distance of n-th prime to nearest square.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
formula: For each prime, find the closest square (preceding or succeeding); subtract, take absolute value.
example: For 13, 9 is the preceding square, 16 is the succeeding. 13-9 = 4, 16-13 is 3, so the distance is 3.
mathematica: a[n_] := (p = Prime[n]; ns = p+1; While[ !IntegerQ[ Sqrt[ns++]]]; ps = p-1; While[ !IntegerQ[ Sqrt[ps--]]]; Min[ ns-p-1, p-ps-1]); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 90}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 18 2011 *)Table[Apply[Min, Abs[p - Through[{Floor, Ceiling}[Sqrt[p]]]^2]], {p, Prime[Range[90]]}] (* _Jan Mangaldan_, May 07 2014 *)
author: _Enoch Haga_, Dec 11 1999
